result.execSummary:
The defendant Soudchai Nmi Visethsounethone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - County Ordinance. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 04/01/2016 and each month thereafter or penalty of 7 days jail, consecutive for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Soudchai Nmi Visethsounethone

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Katie B. Bricco in court.   Defendant Soudchai Nmi Visethsounethone did not appear.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to amend Count #1 to county ordinance disorderly conduct 13.102(c)(8).  Attorney Bricco enters a no contest plea to amended charge on behalf of Defendant.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.  Court finds Defendant guilty of amended charge and imposes fine of $330.50 - to be paid at $50.00 per month, commencing 4/1/16, alternate 7 days jail, consecutive if not paid.

Attorney Katie B. Bricco in court.   Defendant Soudchai Nmi Visethsounethone did not appear.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State is unsure of offer written on file.  Court adjourns.  NOTE:  Defendant is in custody in Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility.  Defendant to appear by videoconference for next court date.  Hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Soudchai Nmi Visethsounethone
Current: PO Box 05911, MSDF, Milwaukee, WI 53205 United States  (Effective: 10-05-2015)
Prior: 412 Sheffield Rd,#2, Waukesha, WI 53186

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Attorney Katie B. Bricco in court.   Defendant Soudchai Nmi Visethsounethone did not appear.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bricco indicates the defendant is incarcerated at MSDF. Next hearing to be by video.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.
